title: Computer Networks
description: Comprehensive course covering networking fundamentals, protocols, security, and modern technologies

topics.title: Introduction to Computer Networks
topics.description: Comprehensive foundation of computer networking fundamentals for college students

topics.title: OSI Reference Model
topics.description: Comprehensive deep dive into the 7-layer OSI model with detailed protocols, examples, and practical applications

topics.title: TCP/IP Protocol Suite
topics.description: In-depth study of TCP/IP stack, addressing, routing, transport protocols, and application layer protocols

topics.title: Network Devices and Infrastructure
topics.description: Comprehensive study of hubs, switches, routers, firewalls, load balancers, and modern network appliances

topics.title: Routing Protocols
topics.description: Detailed coverage of RIP, OSPF, BGP, static routing, dynamic routing, and routing algorithms

topics.title: Network Security
topics.description: Extensive coverage of threats, vulnerabilities, encryption, firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and security best practices

topics.title: Network Troubleshooting
topics.description: Comprehensive guide to diagnostic tools, methodology, common issues, performance optimization, and maintenance

topics.title: Advanced Networking Topics
topics.description: In-depth coverage of SDN, cloud networking, virtualization, QoS, and emerging technologies

prerequisites: Basic understanding of computers and operating systems
learningOutcomes: Understand networking fundamentals and the OSI model
